name: Science
description: Covers basic concepts in Physics and Chemistry.

chapters.name: Physics
chapters.description: Introduction to the world of motion, forces and energy.

questions.question: Which of the following quantities is a vector?
If a car travels 60 km in 2 hours, its average speed is:
According to Newton’s First Law, an object will remain at rest or in uniform motion unless:

options.option_text: An external force acts on it

questions.question: What is the SI unit of force?
An object moves with constant velocity. Which of the following is true?

options.option_text: Net force on the object is zero

questions.question: Displacement is different from distance because:
Which graph represents an object at rest?
If two forces of 5 N and 10 N act in opposite directions, the net force is:

chapters.name: Chemistry
chapters.description: Study of matter and its transformations.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a state of matter?
Particles in a solid are:

options.option_text: Closely packed and vibrate in place

questions.question: Which of the following shows deposition?
The process of changing a liquid to gas is called:
Which of these states of matter has no fixed volume and no fixed shape?
What happens to the particles of a solid when it is heated?

options.option_text: They vibrate faster and may break free

questions.question: Which state of matter conducts electricity and is made of ionized gas?
Sublimation is the change from:
Which part of the cell controls all its activities?
What is the basic unit of life?
Plant cells have an extra outer layer called:
Which organelle is known as the “powerhouse of the cell”?
Identify the structure responsible for protein synthesis:
What is the jelly-like substance inside the cell where organelles are suspended?
Which of the following is found only in plant cells and not in animal cells?
What is the function of the cell membrane?

options.option_text: Controls entry and exit of substances

questions.question: Which of these is the largest organelle in a plant cell?

chapters.name: Algebra
chapters.description: Basics of variables, expressions and equations.

questions.question: What is the value of x in the equation 2x + 3 = 11?
Which of the following represents a linear equation?
Simplify: (3x - 2) + (4x + 5)
Factor: x² - 9
Which of the following is a solution to the equation x/2 = 5?
Solve: 3(x - 2) = 15
Which expression is equivalent to 2(x + 3) - x?
If x = 2 and y = 3, what is the value of 2x + y?
Solve: x² = 16
Which term is a constant in the expression 4x + 7?
Simplify: 5x - 2x + 4
What is the coefficient of x in the expression 7x - 9?
Which of the following is an identity?
Solve: 4x + 1 = 2x + 7
Which of these is a monomial?
If 3x = 12, what is the value of x?
Simplify: (x + 2)(x - 2)
Which of the following is not a polynomial?
Which term is the variable in the expression 9y - 6?
If a = 3 and b = 2, what is the value of ab + a?
